intro: Solanum maranguapense, commonly known as the Maranguape nightshade, is a species native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Solanum maranguapense is part of the nightshade family, which includes many plants with medicinal and toxic properties.
